intro.p: The cost of {{verbing}} {{thing}}s is \${{amount}} per {{thing}} plus an additional \${{fixed_amount}} for fixed costs. Let C(x) be a linear function that models the cost of {{verbing}} x {{thing}}s.

The recent change in population of {{town}} can be described linearly. In {{year}}, the population was {{initial_population}}, and it has {{verbed}} by {{rate}} per year since. Let P(x) be a linear function that models the population x years after {{year}}.

The monthly cost for a cell phone plan is \${{first_line}} for the first line and an additional \${{additional_lines}} for each additional line on this plan. Let C(x) be the cost of the cell phone plan for x additional lines
A family buys a {{bag_size}}-ounce bag of rice. They use {{usage}} ounces per day. Let R(d) represent the amount of rice left in the bag after d days.

A leaky {{vessel}} is losing water at a constant rate of {{rate}} ounces per {{time_unit}}. The {{vessel}} originally contained {{initial_amount}} ounces of water. Let W(x) be the amount of water left in the {{vessel}} after x {{time_unit}}s.

content.p: What is the slope? Explain what this represents in the context of the problem.
What is the y-intercept? Explain what this represents in the context of the problem.
Write a linear function to model the situation. Let x represent {{thing}}s and let C(x) represent the costs.
Write a linear function to model the situation. Let x represent the year since {{year}} and let P(x) represent the popuation.
Write a linear function to model the situation. Let x represent the number of additional lines and let C(x) represent the cost.
Write a linear function to model the situation. Let d represent the number of days elapsed and let R(d) represent the amount of rice left in the bag.
Write a linear function to model the situation. Let x represent the number of {{time_unit}}s elapsed and let W(x) represent the amount of water left in the {{vessel}}.
In what year will the population be {{y}}?
How many additional lines can be purchased for \${{y}}?
After how many days will the family have {{y}} ounces of rice left in the bag?
After how many {{time_unit}}s will the {{vessel}} contain {{y}} ounces of water?
How much does it cost to {{verb}} {{x}} {{thing}}s?
What will the population be in {{x}}?
How much does it cost to have a plan with {{x}} additional lines?
How much rice will be left in the bag after {{x}} days?
How much water will be left in the {{vessel}} after {{x}} {{time_unit}}s?
